p: to the editor: The coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID‐19) outbreak has become a public health emergency globally. 1, 2 Until 26 May 2020, there were 7126 confirmed cases reported in Australia ( https://coronavirus.jhu.edu/map.html). However, specimens of the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS‐CoV‐2) independently isolated in Australia (in Sydney, the Gold Coast and Melbourne) 3 exhibited very unusual mutations, which have not been identified in other countries ( Box, A).
